result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shaquile D Diggs

records.addlTxt: Filed: Original Transcript of Preliminary Hearing ( 12 pages) commencing 10-11-2022 by Amy Wallow.

Defendant Shaquile D Diggs appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Robert Lee Taylor in court for Shaquile D Diggs.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court took judicial notice of 17cf2361. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Officer J. Kranz.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 36.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Shaquile D Diggs appeared by video, in custody in Jackson Correctional.  Attorney Robert Lee Taylor not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness is present. Defense Counsel does not appear and did not contact the court. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Shaquile D Diggs not in court, defendant in custody at Jackson Correctional.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. Jackson Correctional unable to produce defendant due to Covid Issues. Defense counsel did not check in or contact the court. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Shaquile D Diggs in court by video, in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Attorney Taylor is unable to appear for todays matter due to a conflict in calendar scheduling. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Shaquile D Diggs in court by video, in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Attorney Taylor is newly appointed and unable to appear for todays proceedings due to scheduling conflicts. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Robert Lee Taylor in court, defendant Shaquile D Diggs not in court, in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for Hearing. Attorney Robert Taylor has been appointed to represent the defendant. Case addjourned, Branch 38.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Shaquile D Diggs not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminar hearing.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a STATE V-LEE hearing in the trial court. Next date given by the clerk in Br. 38 Hearing scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Shaquile D Diggs not in court, defendant in custody.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Shaquile D Diggs not in court, defendant in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin, via zoom.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW 
CASE HELD VIA ZOOM AND LIVE STREAM ON DA CAST. Case set for Preliminary hearing. Public Defender's office request additional time to appoint counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Shaquile D Diggs in court with attorney Ruby De Leon.  Defendant Shaquile D Diggs in custody.  Jennifer Jean Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Shaquile D Diggs appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
